id: Dealing with Clair, Orange Tree, Richmond review: an amusing, unsettling drama with a tragically topical edge
paragraph:
The notorious unsolved 1986 disappearance of the London estate agent Suzy Lamplugh – suspected murdered at the hands of a man posing as a buyer – hovered like a grim spectre around Dealing with Clair when it premiered at the Orange Tree two years later. How could it not? Martin Crimp’s bleakly amusing, incrementally disquieting drama concerns an attractive young female estate agent drawn into a lethal rapport with a mysterious older man who seems willing and able to pounce – with heaps of cash – on the London property for which she’s seeking a buyer.Now, eerily, a revival at the same venue 30 years on has coincided with a renewed search for Lamplugh’s body.
